result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Takalah T Sandridge-Hall

to withdraw as counsel

9:52 AM Prosecuting attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Takalah T Sandridge-Hall in court.  Attorney Luis C Cuevas in court for Takalah T Sandridge-Hall.  Motion to withdraw as counsel. Defn requests new counsel. CT has colloquy w/ parties. Defn atty responds. Defn has new case pending PH. CT denies motion to withdraw as counsel.
Motion hearing on August 4, 2022 at 09:15 am.
to withdraw as counsel

08:55 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Luis C Cuevas.  Timothy Robert Verhoff appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defn requests new counsel. CT told atty to file motion, CT to set MH. Address verified.
Status conference on July 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:41 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Luis C Cuevas.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defn requests another PTC, address verified.  Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Pre-trial conference on May 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

03:28 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Luis C Cuevas.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Law Enforcement officer, Ashley Hageman, duly sworn & testified; Venue Established; Witness ID'd defn; State moves for bindover - waives argument, reserves for rebuttal; Defense objects to bindover - waives argument; Ct binds case over; bail continued.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

03:20 PM ENTERED IN ERROR. WE STARTED THE HEARING AND THEN THE DE CHANGED HER MIND. Defendant in court with Attorney Luis C Cuevas.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.
Atty Luis Cuevas
Preliminary hearing on March 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:56 AM Court reporter Rowan Thompson. Defendant appeared.  Awais Khaleel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes defendant just found eligible for a public defendant but has not yet been appointed. Court finds good cause to waive time limits and set over. Notice given to defendant in court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on March 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defn here today. She will be reapplying at SPD, if not eligible will come back to determination for Court Appointed Attorney.
Letter from DE re: rescheduling court date

Defendant here today at Collections window to apply for county appointed attorney - to return with completed Petition for Counsel, bring along SPD Financial Eligibility Worksheet and provide most recent paystub.

09:32 AM Defendant Takalah T Sandridge-Hall in court. Prosecuting Atty Benjamin Wagner appeared for State of Wisconsin. DE does not qualify for SPD representation.  DE will apply for CDP today and will return to court to inform if she qualifies.
Zoom
Preliminary hearing on February 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Jamier F. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 12

02:37 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Tracey J Lencioni.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
